article_text:
With less than two weeks to go before Britain’s election, HSBC is performing a public service by threatening to leave London. The bank said Friday it is conducting a new review of whether to keep its headquarters in the U.K., the first time it has reconsidered that question since 2010. British tax policies will weigh heavily on the decision.

Like every global company today, HSBC does business in many countries and is bound to none. Founded in Asia—the “H” and “S” stand for Hong Kong and Shanghai—its headquarters was in...

twitter.description: London starts to pay for its punitive tax policy toward banks, writes the Wall Street Journal in an editorial.
twitter.title: Will Banks Leave London?

image.alt: London starts to pay for its punitive tax policy toward banks.
